title: Executive Order to Address Influence of Foreign-Owned Proxy Advisory Firms on American Investors
summary: This executive order asserts the President's constitutional and statutory authority to take action to address the influence of proxy advisory firms that are foreign-owned on U.S. investors and investment decisions. It identifies two entities, Institutional Shareholder Services Inc. and Glass, Lewis & Co., LLC, as foreign-owned proxy advisory firms that purportedly shape policies and priorities in the American investment landscape. The document explains the purpose of the order, outlining concerns about foreign ownership and perceived political motivation, and describes intended federal actions and coordination with relevant agencies to assess risks, enhance transparency, and mitigate potential undue influence on corporate governance or investment processes. The summary reflects the order's stated objective to safeguard American investors and ensure proxy advisory activities do not undermine domestic financial markets or national interests.

title: Executive Order Establishing a National Policy Framework for Artificial Intelligence
summary: This executive order, issued by the President under constitutional and statutory authority, states the objective of advancing United States leadership in artificial intelligence to strengthen national and economic security and maintain competitive advantage across multiple domains. It references authority from Executive Order 14179 dated January 23 and designates Section 1, titled Purpose, as outlining the rationale for prioritizing AI leadership. The document indicates the establishment or adoption of a national policy framework for artificial intelligence and articulates the intent to coordinate federal actions to support the development, deployment, and governance of AI technologies.

title: National Pearl Harbor Remembrance Day, 2025 Proclamation
summary: The President issues a proclamation designating December 7, 2025 as National Pearl Harbor Remembrance Day and calling on the people of the United States to observe the day with appropriate ceremonies and activities to honor the victims, survivors, and those who defended the nation in the events surrounding Pearl Harbor on December 7, 1941. The proclamation emphasizes reflection on the nation's history and the sacrifices made in defense of the United States.

title: Memorandum: Aligning United States Core Childhood Vaccine Recommendations with Best Practices from Peer Developed Countries
summary: A memorandum addressed to the Secretary of Health and Human Services and the Director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention that describes aligning the United States' core childhood vaccine recommendations with best practices observed in peer developed countries. It references the January 2025 decision to vaccinate all children against 18 diseases, including COVID-19, and outlines objectives, considerations, and steps to harmonize U.S. vaccination guidance with international standards and practices to ensure consistency across the federal framework.

title: Nominations Sent to the Senate for U.S. Attorney and Federal Judges
summary: The White House announced nominations sent to the Senate for three federal positions: James Bishop of North Carolina to be United States Attorney for the Middle District of North Carolina for a four-year term; Megan Blair Benton of Missouri to be United States District Judge for the Western District of Missouri; and Christopher Michael De Bono of the District of Columbia to be an Associate Judge, with the remainder of the position details not shown in the provided excerpt. The post detailing these nominations is titled 'Nominations Sent to the Senate'.

title: Thanksgiving Day, 2025 Proclamation
summary: This Presidential Proclamation designates Thanksgiving Day for 2025. It recounts the historical origin of the holiday, noting that in 1789 President George Washington established the first National Day of Thanksgiving and described the duty of all nations to acknowledge the providence of Almighty God and to be grateful. The proclamation establishes observance across the United States.
